msDesc.head: Conrad von Soltow, Fulgentius of Ruspe, Johannes Klenkok; Germany A c 1400, B 1394

physDesc.p: Composite: two parts, together by the fifteenth century binding.

binding.p: Fifteenth-century binding of plain leather over boards; clasps lost; contemporary contents label.

physDesc.accMat: Endleaves (Sallust, Bellum Jugurthinum, 13th century) now kept as MS. Add. A. 175, part B.

history.provenance: Erfurt Charterhouse: ex libris, upper pastedown (with typical contents list) and fol. 260r; catalogue, E 15.

Friedrich Gottlieb Julius von Bülow, 1760-?1831: identifiable as no. 167 in the 1836 catalogue ('Quaestiones magistrales et breves super omnes libros summarum Conr. Soltow. - Augustinus De fide etc.').
history.acquisition: Presented to the Bodleian Library by his sons and received in 1857.

recordHist.source: Description by Matthew Holford, Sept. 2020. Previously described in the Summary Catalogue. Summary Catalogue, Vol. 5, p. 27

listBibl.head: Online resources:

ref.title: Manuscripts from German-Speaking Lands – A Polonsky Foundation Digitization Project

listBibl.bibl: Balázs József Nemes, Bibliotheca Cartusiae Erfordiensis : Dokumentation über den überlieferten Buchbestand der Erfurter Kartause, 3., korrigierte und erweiterte Version (2022) DOI: 10.6094/UNIFR/223370

msItem.author: Conrad von Soltow
msItem.title: Quaestiones on Peter Lombard's Sentences
msItem.rubric: Questiones integrales et breues circa omnes libros sententiarum comportate per dominum Conradum Soltaw in studio pragen. concurrentem cum Bicipite ibidem. Qui dominus Conradus factus sacre theologie professor postmodum in episcopum Ferdensem electus est.
msItem.incipit: Queritur primo circa primum sententiarum utrum per studium sacre scripture acquiratur habitus alius a fide
msItem.explicit: usque ad diem iudicij vident gloriam sanctorum. Quam nobis concedat qui sine fine viuit et regnat in secula seculorum amen.
msItem.colophon: finis 4tus liber sententiarum per me Wigandum etc. [added:] questiones conradi soltow

msItem.incipit: 1. Utrum per studium sacre scripture acquiratur alius habitus a fide
msItem.explicit: 28. Utrum anime a corpore separate cognoscant

supportDesc.support: Paper. Watermarks: lily with six-petalled flower above (not in Piccard; similar examples in WZIS dated from c. 1383–1430) and lily with eight-pointed star above (type Piccard i.343, 345–51, early fifteenth century)

layoutDesc.layout: (fols. 1ra-155rb) 2 cols., c. 43–7 lines, frame-ruled. Ruled space 235–55 150–60

handDesc.handNote: The main text in one cursive hand (presumably that of 'Wigandus'), extensively corrected throughout in a darker ink. The index in a different cursive hand.

decoDesc.decoNote: Spaces for initials and rubrics unfilled.

history.origin: 14th century, late, or 15th century, early (watermarks) German

msItem.title: Lectura super Firmiter credimus
msItem.incipit: Firmiter credimus et simpliciter confitemur fidem Autorizans magistri gencium Paulos apostolus
msItem.explicit: leticia cum wlto tuo. Ad quam letictiam nos perducat indiuidua trinitas in secula seculorum benedicta. Amen.

msItem.rubric: Isti sunt tytuli questionum contentarum in opere precedenti
msItem.explicit: an beatitudo eterna consistit principaliter in visione
msItem.colophon: Gloria tibi trinitas equalis vna deitas in secula seculorum AMEN

msItem.title: De fide ad Petrum
msItem.rubric: Librum Beati Augustini de fide ad petrum etc.
msItem.incipit: Epistolam fili petre tue caritatis accepi
msItem.explicit: hoc illi quoque deus reuelabit. Hoc est finis huius operis.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber Beati Augustini de fide ad petrum

msItem.author: Johannes Klenkok
msItem.title: Quaestiones super materiam totam Canonicae Johannis
msItem.rubric: Questio Johannis Klenkoch professoris theolgica contingens in se totam materiam canonice beati Johannis
msItem.incipit: Utrum eterna vita manibus contractata sit vere per Johannem in suis canonicis epistolis nuntiata. Arguitur quod non
msItem.explicit: doctum in opere fuit tamen inditum cordibus nostris a mundi creatione etc. Finis huius operis.
msItem.finalRubric: Expliciunt questiones M. Klenkoc sacre theologie professoris in se continens totam materiam canonice Johannis.
msItem.colophon: Finitus est hoc opus sub anno domini millesimo tricentesimo nonagesimo quarto. Da mihi dona tria sanctissima virgo maria. Da spacium vite. Da diuicias sine lite. Regnum celeste post mortem da manifeste.

supportDesc.support: Paper. Watermarks include (fol. 246 etc.) bull's head with six-pointed star above (Piccard type viii.11–150), (fol. 259) bull's head with six-petalled flower above (type Piccard xii.231–363, cf. esp. 241; cf. WZIS DE6405-PO-65273)

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., c. 47–50 lines. Frame-ruled, ruled space 210–25 125–30

handDesc.handNote: One hand; cursive with many unlooped ascenders.

decoDesc.decoNote: Red initials sometimes with flourishing in red.

history.provenance: Colophon, fol. 258v. The date 1394 was taken in the Summary Catalogue as the date of the work, but Klenkok died before 1374; the watermarks are consistent with a date of 1394.

msItem.title: Injunctions from a visitation of the Erfurt Charterhouse, 1410

revisionDesc.change: Description revised after examination of watermarks.
New draft description for Polonsky German.
